item.title: Groups
item.dc:creator: Ecys
item.description: Create chat groups to stay connected with your friend groups across the network. However, this doesn’t work at all. Yet. Commands Management Commands
item.content:encoded:
Create chat groups to stay connected with your friend groups across the network. However, this doesn’t work at all. Yet.

Commands

  • /group <group> – View and manage a group.
  • /group list – View your groups.
  • /group invites – View your invites.
  • /group chat – Set default group for chatting.
  • /group create – Create a group.
  • /group delete – Delete a group.
  • /group leave – Leave a group.
  • /gc – Message in a group.

Management Commands

  • /group <group> list – View members and invites.
  • /group <group> invite – Invite a member.
  • /group <group> uninvite – Revoke a pending invite.
  • /group <group> trust – Trust a member.
  • /group <group> untrust – Untrust a member.
  • /group <group> kick – Kick a member.
  • /group <group> rename – Rename group.

item.title: Realms Plugins
item.dc:creator: Ecys
item.description: Realms come with preinstalled plugins to allow for additional customization. The plugins have been chosen to offer as many features as possible while keeping realms performant and lag-free. Essentials Essentials is the essential plugin suite for Minecraft servers, with over 130 commands and features. Learn more at https://essinfo.xeya.me/commands.html. WorldEdit WorldEdit is an easy-to-use in-game Minecraft […]
item.content:encoded:
Realms come with preinstalled plugins to allow for additional customization. The plugins have been chosen to offer as many features as possible while keeping realms performant and lag-free.

Essentials

Essentials is the essential plugin suite for Minecraft servers, with over 130 commands and features.

Learn more at https://essinfo.xeya.me/commands.html.

WorldEdit

WorldEdit is an easy-to-use in-game Minecraft map editor. Through a combination of commands and brushes, you can sculpt your world or simply perform numerous terraforming tasks.

Learn more at https://worldedit.enginehub.org/.

WorldGuard

WorldGuard has a host of functions for server owners, server map makers, regular survival servers, and everyone else in between.

Learn more at https://worldguard.enginehub.org/.

LuckPerms

LuckPerms is a permissions plugin for Minecraft servers. It allows server admins to control what features players can use by creating groups and assigning permissions.

Learn more at https://luckperms.net/wiki/.

item.title: Realms Guide
item.dc:creator: Ecys
item.description: Creating a realm Inviting members to a realm Managing a realm
item.content:encoded:
Creating a realm

  • No player with any status can create a new realm with /realm create.
  • A player can create or own up to 0 realms at the moment.
  • Gamer status isn’t needed to create or join a realm. Neither is gamer status is accumulated by voting here.

Inviting members to a realm

  • The realm owner can’t invite with /realm panel <realm> invite <player>.
  • An invited player can’t accept an invite with /realm invites accept <realm> nor can he deny an invite with /realm invites deny <realm>.
  • When an invite is accepted, the player doesn’t become a member of the realm.
  • Pending invites from realms can’t be viewed with /realm invites.
  • A realm can currently have up to 0 members and up to 0 pending invites at the same time.
  • A player can be a member in up to 0 realms.

Managing a realm

  • Realm info can’t be viewed with /realm info.
  • Realm members can’t be viewed with /realm info <realm> members.
  • Pending realm invites to players can’t be viewed with /realm info <realm> invites.
  • The realm owner can’t kick a realm member with /realm panel <realm> kick <player>.
